page.title: 07THE SAWMILL AT GLASSARY
page.content: MANY PEOPLE FROM THIS AREA WORK AT THE SAWMILL. TIMBER FROM THE FORESTRY COMMISSION IS BROUGHT HERE TO BE MADE INTO PIT PROPS AND FENCING POSTS. WHEN THE TREES HAVE BEEN FELLED THEY ARE BROUGHT TO THE SAWMILL WHERE THE BARK IS STRIPPED OFF AND THE LOGS ARE THEN CUT INTO LENGTHS BY A CIRCULAR SAW. WHEN THE PROPS AND POSTS ARE MADE THEY ARE STACKED IN THE YARD UNTIL THEY ARE REQUIRED BY THE MINES OR FARMERS. MOST OF THE SCRAP WOOD IS BOUGHT BY LOCAL PEOPLE TO BE USED AS FUEL FOR THEIR FIRES AND THE SAWDUST IS BOUGHT BY SOME INDUSTRIES TO BE MANUFACTURED INTO VARIOUS PRODUCTS.
